Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Avicenna.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, my children, as you have completed this book, the last of medical science, by the completion of which its end is achieved, and through its explanations, expositions, and declarations, it seems to me that you have fully grasped this treatise, which is a part of the most important operations, namely, surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For surgery, considered the most important operation in our region and time, is shrouded in great secrecy, as knowledge of it has declined; and there remain only a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which have led to much confusion and error regarding its principles and practice.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it appears to me that you have revitalized the order of this treatise through a second method of exposition and declaration and abridgment; and so that the forms of cautery tools and other instruments for the work may be added as an explanation, and to prepare for it, which is a necessary cause.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The cause for which our skilled physician lacks mastery in this our time is because the art of medicine is complex, and he has not been trained in the science of anatomy, which reveals the youthfulness of the members, their forms, their conjunction and separation; the knowledge of bones, nerves, and ligaments, their names, and their extraction; the pulsation of the veins, the places of their emission.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this reason Hippocrates says that the name is fitting, for in practice it is small, but most importantly in the art of healing.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already discussed this at the beginning of this book; for those who are not knowledgeable about what we have said about anatomy, it is not to be wondered that they fall into errors that lead to the death of men, as you have seen many such individuals, some formed in this science and believing themselves experts through their experiences.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	You see a foolish doctor who has incurred a serious infection in the thigh of a woman by cutting into her flesh and incising some of the thigh's arteries, allowing great pus to flow until the woman died from it.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And you see another doctor who quickly took a stone from a man who had passed it in his state, and the stone was large, and he brought it out and extracted that stone with a part of the bladder, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And you have already called for haste to extract it, and you see that because of the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, he will die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And you see another doctor who was paid handsomely by a duke from our land for surgery, and he took on a black crusty wound that was severely infected in the patient's thigh; because of his ignorance, the doctor extracted the fracture, over the infection, using plasters and strips with strong stretching, and did not allow the infection to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then free the patient according to their wishes, apply relaxation, rest, and bandages for some days, and order that the incision be closed; and so too, as soon as the wound in the foot has healed, prevent further harm.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And you will have called upon him, and he will free the bandage, and thus achieve peace and permanently alleviate their pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, if the corruption is already confirmed in the member, then it cannot be restrained, and the corruption will continue to spread throughout the member until the patient perishes from the illness.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And see another doctor who perforates a cancerous abscess, and it becomes ulcerated after some days, until the fire of his malice intensifies in him under his lordship.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Which causes is because the sharp pain is purely from melancholic humor; then it does not cover that it will reach him entirely with a ferrule, but rather that it should be in the member where it suffers most and is most vulnerable.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, my sons, it is necessary for you that the operation be divided into two parts: one is an operation associated with health, and the other is a work that poses danger to the most vital dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already encountered this throughout all parts of this book where operations are discussed that contain error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to take heed of these things and set them aside, so that people do not take advantage and shame you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore, take up your arms with diligence and the protection of God, and your patients with ease and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best means by the grace of God to attain salvation and glorious success, set aside the terrible illnesses that are difficult to cure, and abandon your weapons of fear, so that your faith and name do not desert you; for more remains to your glory, both now in this world and later behind your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Crack open some of their secret parts:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat bad ailments with bad medicines, so that bad doctors are not blamed.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And you have already divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, starting with the first section.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter is ordered on the feet, in the forms of instruments and in the tools of cautery, and anything that is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	Division of the second section.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter deals with incisions and punctures, and the use of vents, plagues (possibly referring to pustules or sores), and the extraction of arrows and similar foreign bodies. It is entirely structured around the forms and uses of medical instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and realignment, and the treatment of twists and similar conditions; a structured chapter on foot inner structures and the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	With fire cautery and sharp medicine, and the recall of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	At that point begins the treatment of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Understand what I have said about the quality of the fire of that cautery and the documents of it, and in what conditions cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, it is said that the discourse on the quality of cautery fire and the documents of it is long and prolix, subtle for knowledge, and secrets hidden; and much has been spoken about it by many wise men, and there are disagreements among them, and I will content myself with a brief part of their discourses, for fear of prolongation.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore it is said that cautery will relieve every kind of pain universally, whether it be physical or spiritual, except for two conditions, which are pains caused by their own nature.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the condition where pain is caused by a lack of matter (or dryness), some say that cautery is beneficial for it, while others claim the opposite, stating that cautery is not suitable for ailments caused by quality and dryness, as fire itself embodies quality and dryness, and it would be inappropriate to treat an ailment lacking moisture with heat and dryness.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who claim the opposite state that cautery is beneficial for any dry and painful condition in the human body, as when you compare the human body and its humidity to the nature of fire, you find the body dry.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And he says through the arguments of those who claim this, that he has personally experimented with it numerous times to discover.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not advisable for this to be handled by someone who has no experience in the practice of cautery and who is unfamiliar with the diversity of physical conditions in people, their causes, the circumstances under which they occur, or the passage of time regarding them.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other conditions, there is no cause for fear, especially in cases of pain and swelling, as all doctors are agreed on these, and they do not disagree about the use of cautery to treat them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, my children, that the secret of healing by cautery with fire and the goodness of it, lie in cautery as a medicinal flame; for fire is simple, whose action only reaches the member being cauterized, without affecting other members with its heat, except to a slight degree.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	The action of the medicinal flame reaches those members from which it withdraws, and strongly causes pain in a member affected by a difficult-to-heal illness, aiding greatly in its healing.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Kindle the fire, due to its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, does not cause harm, and it is already known to us from experience and from the long study of the art on the truth of the causes; for this reason, I excuse you from the length of my speech. And if it were not that this secret fire, which I hide in this brief pause, cannot be read at my free will, the quality of its operation in the body and its expulsion through which we eliminate illnesses, demonstrated by philosophical discourse, would be sharpened in your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, my children, that the time of discord is when cauterization and bandaging should be performed, and it is best to do so in the springtime.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And you say that cauterization is convenient at all times, so that the damage caused by accidental time may be overcome by the youthfulness of what is removed through cauterization, and most especially when cauterization is for pains or necessary pains, severe and acute, which do not suffer delay, since it is feared those that come with malice, that it is better to minimize damage entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And so you must not fear in your hearts, o sons, for this condition is not esteemed by the common people or foolish doctors; it is that with such illness treated by cautery, it is not always completely cured, and they leave behind a consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not understood thus by those who care for it, for cautery is but a place of medicine that alters the composition and dries up moisture, which is the cause why pain comes.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Yet, they may use cautery superfluously over medicine because of the will to assert its validity and the virtue of its operation and the power of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that their illness may return at some time in the future, according to the composition of the illness and the location of their malady, and the strength of it, and what is prepared within them from the addition of excesses and humors, and what is acquired by them through food and similar causes; but the illness in which cautery is administered is a subtle illness in a few members with slight excesses and humidities, so with a tooth cautery for pain and similar to that, it is possible that that pain may not return in them, but this is done in small doses.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is a common saying that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a true saying, not to those who understand it, for they believe that there is no cure that profits from medicine or any other cause by cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the reason is to the contrary; and the understanding that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is not but when one administers the methods of healing in certain ailments, and those medicines confer no benefit, and then at the end of the cause, one applies cautery, and profits from it.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from this it follows that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the understanding of the common people and too many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this but for the equality of gold and the subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they say that the place of cautery does not burn unless it is absolutely true, for you have already seen and experienced that it only burns in certain bodies, and cauterizing with fire from gold is good and better than what they said; however, when you make a cautery with fire, it is not declared to you, because the gold is consumed according to the quantity you want due to the heat of the fire, and if you place it over the fire, some sheets will fall into the fire for the artisan to catch due to the occupation.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this, cauterizing with iron must be done more lightly and precisely to ensure the correctness of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	You have already organized this chapter on cauterization according to chapters, and you have organized those from the beginning within the feet, so now I am asking him what he wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Regarding cauterization for head pain caused by cold and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery confers warmth and heat to the affected area, which is a remedy for two causes: it is effective against sudden cold and numerous rheumatic fluxes, called coryza, from the head to the parts of the nose and ears, frequent sleep, toothache and throat pain, and generally all ailments that arise from coldness, as well as paralyses, soddenness and apoplexy, and similar conditions in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cautery is as follows: first, you must command the disease to be evacuated using a laxative medicine, for three or four nights, depending on the severity of the illness, the age of the patient, and their usual condition.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command them to shave their head, and place that sharp object between your legs on a heated bench, and place your hands on the affected foot.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place your palm's pressure on the bridge of their nose between their eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, if the pain in the middle of the foot has been alleviated, mark that spot with a try, and then heat the olive cautery whose shape is as follows:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that over the unmarked spot with pressure, in a descending manner, so that your hand is constrained little by little, and you lift it up.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Then gently lift your hand and examine the spot, and if you see that some bone is exposed along with any quantity of fat, raise your hand again, and if it doesn't return to that position, or if it's chilled, as long as you can see the bone, do as I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt, dissolve it over the spot, and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place your hand over the burnt area at the border, leaving that one inside to destroy the wall of fire.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with the four-part medicine until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And it is said that when the Roman plague opens, the arm gets better and more youthful, so it is better and more restorative.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	They also say that the bone should be cauterized within the bone, and the cautery should be held until some part of the specific nature of the bone is hardened.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove what is adjusted to the bone, and then cure it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And they say others that with the cautery you should reach the rear, while always strengthening the bone inward, until the bone hardens, and this is the form of creating small incisions:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that place, vapors from the head escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if the wound remains open for a long time, it should be treated until it is healed and strengthened.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I do not recommend these two types of cautery to everyone, but only in certain cases out of fear; and that one, for me, is better for health when it is appropriate, because the head has been deprived of continuity through solution as we have witnessed in other members, and especially when the nature of the disease is feverish.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the specific type of cautery that comes first is more safe and better for me; and from this and through this work to health.

Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	One may use cauterizing medicines or burning remedies such that you take a hot iron, and scorch it and cut off the ends of them from both heads.

Capitol .xiiii.	**Chapter XIII**
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	**On the Cauterization of Nose Abscesses**
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When treating the condition we discussed in the previous section and your medication is not effective, prepare a mixture for the patient to drink for three nights; then shave their head and cauterize the affected area with a hot iron.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And cauterize that area with a clamp, using two cauteries on both sides of the eyebrows, leaving just a small amount of hair.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn that area.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the cautery clamp.
Capitol .xv.	**Chapter XV.**
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the use of cautery for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by illness or moisture, apply a cautery to that eyelid with this lunar cautery; and this is the form of it:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, apply this cautery over the two eyebrows with a small amount of cautery at each end, and they will be elongated from the temporals.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the quantity of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with the cautery, but according to how much the third part of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	**Chapter XVI**
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the cautery of the eyelid, when the hairs turn into parts within and press on the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eyelid turn into parts within and press on the eye, cautery is performed in two manners: either by making incisions or by using a medicinal fire.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you use fire for cautery, instruct the patient to comb their hairs in the opposite direction of how they normally grow, so that they are prolonged and intertwined; and if you must apply it again, tighten the eye of the eyelid with a bandage so that the hairs do not become matted.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Therefore, when they are clean and washed, place the patient's head on the pillow, and then examine the socket of their eye with your hand, signaling according to the shape of a dead leaf, and indicating the beginning of the signal near the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then apply a cold compress or a moist cloth over the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then apply the heat with the instrument shaped like this.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize along the marked figure, slowly and in several passes, until the surface of the wound is completely sealed, just as if it were with a leaf of myrtle, clearly visible.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of healing of the eye is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted and the hairs raised at the site of the eye's puncture.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And so raise your hand and place it there for three days, then apply a hot compress to the affected area until the swelling subsides.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then apply that remedy until it is cured.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	If it returns through the skin for any reason, and the eyelid becomes softened, then do the cautery on that part again as you had done originally.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	If the hairs are in the eyelid, then cauterize it until it is raised to its natural position and healed, so that the hairs do not remain odorous.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicines is what you command the patient to do with the hairs until they are prolonged and healed, and then a piece of cloth shaped like a fir leaf should be made from it.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take some known soap and a living flame, or what is suitable for this purpose, and mix those causes well, making it into a paste so that it does not freeze; and spread it from there onto the cloth formed like a myrtle leaf, and place it on one or both wounds; and leave the fragrant edge soaked in white wax, and keep the patient's head in a cool place.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And then stop talking about the medicine and apply a small amount, not too much, so that the patient feels the bite of the medicine, for its bite is like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And so, as it continues to feel the medicine's bite, stop the treatment and apply it again according to its original location; then, when the biting ceases, clean the wound with water; and consider whether the eyelid has been lifted as if washed by fire or incision, for that is the desired state. And if it does not return to the application of the medicine at the site where it was first applied without disfigurations, then your operation will be in vain and the wound will contract.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then apply pressure to the area until the pain of the adhesion is eradicated, and take care with a definite ointment or other until it heals.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, in your operation, to maintain careful vigilance that no part of the medicine falls away, and if after several days the eyelid becomes softened due to some cause from the hair in the socket, then repeat your medicine on that place where the eyelid is softened, and indeed just as you did at the beginning, and surround it until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the way of making an eye-drop.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you know that the eyes of men differ in size and shape, and therefore your treatment must be adjusted accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And let not the method of treatment be hidden from him who studies this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter .xvii.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of a fistula in the lacrimal duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula with the method we have described for the division of illnesses and your treatment does not work, be aware that when cauterizing it in this way: command the patient to rest their head on their side, and hold their head with some minister between their thighs in such a manner that it is neither damaged nor agitated by their own head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then apply some warm compress or a paste of honey and grain meal to the eye of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And shape the cautery as follows:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be concave, shaped like a cane or a quill, from one end where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you look, they penetrate into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you wish to get out, do so with caution.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	Yet he who is calm is better for the task at hand.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And press the fistula if it is open, and try to clean and dry that area.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and extract the pus from that area.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place over it a hot cautery, and with your hand protect the area from the heat of the cautery at the root of the nose, so that your hand or the patient's pain is not aggravated, and apply the cautery to the gray parts of the nose and burn that.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And therefore, if at the beginning of applying the cautery it penetrates into the bone, that is good; otherwise, repeat the cautery once or twice, as necessary, and leave it in place for three days, then apply a compress with a drying ointment until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If after passing ten days it is not healed, then return to using the sharp corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and clean, as you have been taught in your chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another way of applying the cautery for a fistula: they first enter the place of the fistula and make it, then apply pressure to that small fissure from which it arises: and pour into it the amount of melted lead; hold your hand with good restraint so as not to harm the patient by reason that the melted lead does not reach the wound; cover what you have applied over the wound of the illness with white cloth or water, so that the lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals it in a wonderful manner.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cautery and treatment, it is good; otherwise, it will be necessary to administer medicine from the nose and return the fistula to its place in the nose as it should be.
Capitol .xviii.	**Chapter XVIII**
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	**On the Cauterization of the Hernia (Fistula)**
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	You may encounter various accidents that cause fistulas in the lips, especially in children's lips.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, if you treat those fistulas as we have said in the previous sections and do not take advantage of your treatment, then use a heated knife to make a small incision according to this form that I will show:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	and the cavity of it according to the thinness of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Place your hand carefully over those cracks so that the cautery reaches the depth of the cracks.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then carefully remove that cold compress until the area is healed.
Capitol .xix.	**Chapter XIX**
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	**On the Cauterization of Fistulas in the Mouth**
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the case of uvula or palate fistulas, or those between the teeth, a breakdown occurs and an opening forms, and the proper treatment is not applied, you must ignite a cautery according to the extent of the fistula. Insert the burning instrument into the opening of the fistula, and with your hand, guide it until the hot tip reaches the depth of the wound; do this once or twice. Then apply the cold compress as previously described for healing.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And thus, if the wound is clean and healed, it is good; otherwise, it becomes necessary to expose the location and remove the corrupted bone as will be discussed in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	**Capitol XX:**
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cauterization of teeth and the softening of arteries.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the arteries are softened by moisture and the teeth are decayed, and these conditions do not improve with medication, then place the patient's chin on their thigh, and shape the cautery so that when you place the flame over the tooth, it enters slightly, allowing the patient to feel the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth, which has been reached.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift your hand, and repeat the application of the cautery several times as desired.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then make the patient gargle with salt water and hold it for an hour, after which stop it, because the decayed tooth is secured, the softened gums are tightened, and the corrupted moisture is dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter .xxi.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the treatment of tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to cold, or there is a sore or abscess, and the treatment with medicine does not help, then cauterize it in two ways: either with cow dung cautery or with fire cautery.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with cow dung is to take cow dung and smash it into powder, then wrap the mixture over the base of the tooth with a cloth, immerse it in hot water, and place that on the aching tooth until it becomes numb.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeat this several times until the heat from the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you see, dip a cloth or linen in the wound on that side, place it over the aching tooth, and place the heated iron on it until the iron reaches the depth of the tooth's cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, the use of fire for cauterization is to address the wound of iron or flame, and it should not be too harsh on the patient's body, nor should the intensity of the fire reach the mouth of the wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then shape the cautery as needed, place it over the tooth, and rest your hand on it until the cautery cools down; do this several times because the pain may return either that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And ensure that the patient opens their mouth wide and holds the cautery for about an hour, then spit it out; this is the shape of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And apply the cautery as you have seen fit according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the shape of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cauterization of extrophules.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When extrophules are filled with flecma and bad humors that are resistant to digestion due to medicines, and you wish to drain them slightly, apply the cautery according to their shape, having two wide extremities so that the smoke of the cautery reaches the other end. You should place the burning cautery on one spot, then another if further drainage is needed, until it reaches the point of the extrophule.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the extrophule is small, apply the cautery according to its size, then leave it for three days and place a compress over it, close to the edge, until it has healed completely from what the fire has burned.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then apply that ointment and bandages until it heals.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the catheter or the pointed cautery is used in such a way.
Capitol .xxiii.	**Chapter XXIII**
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cauterization of veins and the constriction of arteries.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity appears on the pleura of the lung, especially when it is chilled by a gathering of fluid, then one must evacuate that ill-health at once with laxative medicines, and apply cautery to that place where the pleura is affected.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And be careful not to harm the pleura with the cautery or to inflame the patient's chest too much.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize that or another cautery on the joint of the neck at the last vertebra of the patient.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	The cautery of it is nailed in the manner previously described.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then take care of that as described above until it is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On cauterization for lung disease and cough.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and lung disease are caused by humidity, and the patient has no fever or phlegm, and it is an old illness, then cauterize as follows: make two points with cautery on the furcula at places where the lungs tremble and rise; and another point in the middle part of the foot between two mammary glands; and both cauteries are nailed as described above.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, your cauterization with pointed instruments should be the cautery called a point, whose shape precedes in the puncturing of the pain of ears.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And there should be points within these; and then carefully tend to that as it is mentioned before for its cure.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And already the cautery has three prongs for cauterization to that extent: at one time, you can make three cauteries according to this form:
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On cauterization of the throat, which is the chief duty of the assistant.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the assistant is dislocated due to slippery humidity and it does not stick in its return time, you should reduce its dislocation until it returns to normal, and then place the patient on their back or side; and raise the knee that was initially affected, inside the fold of the thigh towards the left, if the joint is dislocated inward.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then apply the cautery, which has two tips; this is its form:
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	And then apply the cautery to the vein while it penetrates into another part; and the figure of the cauterization will appear when using a cautery with four tips.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	and so they are subtle according to the amount of effort; and this is its form:

De cauterizacio del stomac.	About the cauterization of the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura. De cauterizacio de la mayra.	**On the Cauterization of the Eye.**
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When inflammation and moisture occur in the eye, which prevents impregnation, corrupts the menstruation, delays conception, and causes pain during sexual intercourse, then know that the place should be cauterized with three cauteries around the navel, as we have said regarding the cauterization of the bladder; or with two cauteries, and they should be well-made.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter .XL.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	On the cauterization of dislocated ankle bones.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moist mucous membranes are infiltrated at the joint of the ankle, and they cause the displacement of its parts, and a sign of it is that the affected area is prolonged over the other when compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the place of the dislocation is squeezed in it, causing pain.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Then you should cauterize the patient over the dislocated ankle joint with a circular cautery, since you will have tried to loosen the joint circle around it, and thus the joint falls back into its proper place in the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And the cautery mentioned above has its form in the cauterization of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if this cautery is not available to you, then cauterize it with three large olive cauteries.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And make the cautery according to the amount of inflammation in all the veins; and be careful with that which is healed.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter XLII
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On the cauterization of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain appears in the area of the ankle, caused by cold and moisture, the illness is treated with the method we have mentioned and should not be ignored, as it is an ancient practice to remove the illness from the body using thick humors or foul pills or artificial ones similar to them; and then cauterize that area.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the method of the cautery on that area follows two ways: either with cauteries using burning medicines or with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	Turn according to two knowledgeable methods, of which one is to cauterize that over the opening of the anus with three triangular cautery instruments in this manner; and do it with good depth.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And the space between each cautery should be according to the thickness of the said part, and if the cautery is olive-sized or large.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	In some cases, the cautery can be placed on the middle part over the anus' opening so that there are four cauterizations.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	And if you wish, cauterize the circle from which the shape is taken in the cauterization of the anus' dislocation, one that is circular and burns away all the moisture.
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the method of cauterization in which pain is adhering to the anus and not extended into the thigh.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	If it is extended within the space, then cauterize that place with two cauteries over the thigh at the point where you direct the pain; and make a cautery on the shin four times, slightly on the outer side.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if the cautery is cuttle, then the depth of the cautery should be according to the intensity of the pain.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the pain shifts to the point where it is intense in both feet, then cauterize that place with a cautery at three, four, or more points as needed.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the patient experiences intense pain when lying on their back with the thigh affected, then cauterize that place with a cuttle cautery.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And be careful in all cauterizations so that you do not harm nerves or cause great pain, and thereby aggravate the patient's condition or constrict them.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And you have already seen one of those which will be cauterized over the bone and finished in the cauterization, and a fire bed inflated until the swelling has reached the foot, and the fire pierced and corrupted all the foot.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And then I apply a strong acid solution of the stomach, and thus I bring about death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two parts, then cauterize each according to this manner.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And the wise ones say about the cauterization with hot iron, which is this manner: make it resemble a circle of iron where the circumference is the width of a palm; and its opening should be according to the thickness of a date palm or slightly more.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And within that circle, make another one-third its size; and leave the space between them equal to the night's duration; and these circles should be divided into two parts; and the length of those lines should be a knot or two knots, and fashion these edges of iron decoratively in the shape of circles; and this is its form.
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Near the fire, it is heated until it turns red and gives off sparks, then placed over the affected area of the leg, with the patient lying on their side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And so it is cauterized with three round cauteries at once.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then it is wrapped for three days; the wound is dressed with a border and left open for several days, and treatment continues until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Diys Albucasis: Oh, sons, we have seldom used this kind of cautery due to the fear of its appearance, and because few have found those that regard it favorably.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	One should apply the best cautery to those who suffer from it, and find the appropriate place for it.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	Maybe cauterization and medicines should be used to make two circles with a perforated armor on the frame of the door, whose length on the wall in the middle of their width is equal to two nuts or something like that.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the spaces between certain parts are such that they correspond to the thickness of the said part, place cushions beneath and above them, and ensure they hold each other in this manner.
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	Then place your hand over the affected area of the ankle of the patient, and take some cold water and pour it between two circles; the quality of that water should be gradually heated by fire, for a duration of an hour, and the patient should endure the burning and squeezing — as if by fire — until the burning ceases.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	Then raise your hand with the instrument, and remove all cold water from the affected area using warm water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	And then return it for three days and rest on that edge until the swelling of the adjustment subsides, leave it for some days, and it will heal; this is later in youth.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then apply treatment until it is healed.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain is widespread in the thigh or leg, apply a compress containing water as it is done with hot water.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the method of water treatment, and you have already written about it in the treatise on the rectification of medicines.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Prepare a mixture of alkali and cause from both parts, grind them, and place in a new vessel, into which the opening of the former part is perforated with a small hole according to the amount that fits inside.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	And place the bottom of one wave against another or in a different position, and then sit on that alkaline and living base of hot water, which takes away pain with a single touch, and after you have tightly compressed them with your hand in a good way, release the pressure so that the hot water from the wave descends into the part where the cold wave was.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	Then adjust all that water, sit it on another living cause and another renewable alkaline, so that now it becomes a very powerful strength, which is administered in most medical operations and in the cauterization of other members, because operation involves fire.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And there are some medicines that are cauterized with broad applications, both quickly and skillfully, mixing them with more delicate causes in such a way that they become more effective.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	He here relates the story of a man from ancient times who performed an operation and cure for pain in the water and sciatic vein, and magnified as very beneficial from that, and says it is not necessary for any other treatment, and because he healed it completely by re-treating, for he immersed him strongly in the bath and immediately freed him of that.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	And it is that one should take a fresh fig or, if not available, some other fruit; twist it slightly and place it on the water where the pain is located, in the joint, or in the leg, and leave it there.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	And it should be left for three hours or as long as the pain subsides from the joint's movement.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	Then immerse that part in water and, when the body is relaxed, insert it into the sun, as the pain ceases and healing occurs.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	And know that one should not use cautery with these medicines, but rather focus on the body's evacuation.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	You may already know that when the vein in the goat's foot is cauterized with a narrow flame, it becomes moist; and the cautery should be applied to it in this manner: take wool and dip it in ancient oil, then place it between the toes of the foot and between the bones.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	And then take a dry goat's hair and apply it to the affected area over the fire until it forms a carbuncle; then place it on the wool and open it when it is stretched.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	And repeat this, and do not stop until the spark of the bite disappears from the water and the pain is relieved.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	And this method of cauterization is called the cattle cautery.

De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	On the cauterization of pains.
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	Sometimes pain is felt in the back for various reasons, such as stiffness or bruising or excessive evacuation, and for similar causes, due to the infusion of irritant and wet matter.

De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	On cauterization at the beginning of jaundice.
Motas veguadas endeve aquesta malautia als petitz enfantz; e senhal del comensament de lu en les enfantz es que accideys sobre lor estrectura en le ale eves la elevacio e·l movement. De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	On cauterization of gout and joint pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament. De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	On cauterization of fractures.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre. entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	Within which is a moist and wrinkled skin.

And observe carefully the position of the hernia during cauterization to avoid disturbing it, so that it does not lead to the patient's death or other grave illness.

E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And be mindful that the cautery on children should be delicate according to their size and age.

E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And it is necessary to prevent the flow of nutrition to it according to the duration of the patient's recovery, which straightens their belly, and that the hernia does not come out due to the effort of healing.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And then, after approximately ten days, when it is desired to remove it, the treatment should be administered properly and it should be held for another ten days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And it should be reduced in work and the intake of food and wine, and from loud voices, for when this regimen of healing is followed diligently, complete recovery will follow.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And I will now describe the treatment for ruptures in other parts of the belly, at the very beginning, and since they do not heal, cauterize the rupture with a red hot cautery according to the amount of matter that is extruded from the hernia, just as with the third part of the belly; and then care should be taken for that which we have said, and it should not be pressed too tightly.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And they already said that the first rupture should be cauterized with a triangular cautery according to this form, as it is indicated and tried.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And they stop the line that goes for the latitude in the flesh above the rupture, and another line below; and place your hand with a pointed cautery, but the first cautery is lighter and better.
