De perforacio de eyssedura accident en la mayre.	On the perforation of the eye's cavity in emergencies.
Motas specias de apostemas accideysso en la mayre, ayssi cum cranc e apostema lapident e ulceracios e adhubelat e erpetromens e fistulas emorroyas e raguarrias e thyl e autres apostemas.	There are various specific instances of abscesses occurring in the eye, such as with inflammation, abscesses, ulcers, swelling, herpetic eruptions, fistulas, haemorrhages, and other types of abscesses.
E yeu ja he dit aquestas malautias e las specias de aquelas e les senhals de aquelas, e las curacios de lor en la divisio.	And you have already described these ailments, their types, the signs of those conditions, and the treatment for them in detail.
E cove que yeu digua en aquest tractat de apostema caut le qual ve en la mayre quan es dels apostemas que collegeysso sania, e si vols saber en qual manieyra se fa la opperacio de lu am ferr. Adonc cove que tu consideres si la dolor de la apostema en le sieu comensament es aguda am percussio e flecma e febre, e vezes aquel enrogezir e si catz sobre aquel le sentiment, lahoras no·t coytes am perforacio de lu, e cura aquel am aquo que ajuda sobre la maturacio entro que cesse la acuitat dels accidentz. E lahoras cove que tu fassas cezer la femna sobre una cezelha que aia doas cezelhas; e recline sobre le sieu dos e ajusta les sieus pes a la partida pus dejos del ventre, e las sieus coyssas sian expandudas, e pausa les sieus brasses dejos les sieus denols, e lia quascus am liament ad aquo convenient.	And now know that you should stop the flow of blood by applying a compress on a vein that has two openings; and have the patient lie on their back and position their feet below the abdomen, expanding their thighs, holding their arms below their shoulders, and binding them with something appropriate.

E cove quan vols ministrar aquest instrument que tu fiques am lo ray le preon de la mayre de la femna, e aquo que del instrument es intrat en la mayre no sia mays que·l preon de la mayre e leda le malaute. Mays si l’estrument es major que·l preon de la mayre, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils sobre la textura del preon de la mayre per sso que sia prohibit l’intrament de tot instrument en le preon de la mayre. E cove que tu pauses le vertitge que corr en le strument del latz pus desus e que le ministre tengua le strument e revolva le vertitge entro que sia ubert le orrifici de la mayre.	And you must hold the instrument's edge above the incision and have the assistant hold the instrument, then turn the edge within until the woman's orifice is open.
E cum appar la excitura, e es tocada am la ma e es leon e molh, lahoras cove que tu secces aquela deves le cap de lu am spatum lat.	And when the excitation appears and it is hot and moist, then you must quickly cut off that part with a sharp knife.

And after the discharge is evacuated, you must place over the wound a pad soaked in warm oil or olive oil with some coagulant; and apply pressure to the section in the womb's point.
E pause deforo la mayre e sobre le pentenilh lana munda submersa en aygua en la qual sian bulidas malvas.	And place outside the wound a clean cloth soaked in water with mallows.
E aprop sia curada aprop dos dias am enguent le qual conveneys ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then the cure is completed in two days, finding what convenes for it until it is healed.

Capitol .lxxv.	Chapter .lxxv. (This appears to be a heading or title, indicating the beginning of a new section in the medical treatise.)
A ensenhar las matronas en qual manieyre les enbrios bius sian medicatz quan yeysso segon figura no-natural.	To teach midwives in what manner the living embryos must be treated when they present in an unnatural form.
Necessaria causa es que la matrona conogua en le comensament la figura del enfantament natural per senhals de lu, e es que quan tu vezas la femna expremar a las partidas dejos e desira odorar le ayre, e sobre aquo es enleujada per aquo que sobre ela es del part, e festina le eyssiment del enbrio, lahoras sapias que aquest part es segon figura natural, e es l’eyssiment de lu sobre le sieu cap, e la segondina am aquel o suspensa o pendent del ombelic.	A midwife must recognize the beginnings of labor when the woman experiences contractions and has an intense desire for air, and she is drawn in these ways due to the pressure of the child within her, and she quickly prepares for childbirth, then you will know that this labor is according to a natural figure; the child's head descends first, followed by the second stage where the baby is either suspended or hanging from the umbilical cord.
Donc cum tu vezes aquels senhals, lahoras cove que·l ventre de lu sia compremut per so que l’embrio deysenda leugerament quar quan deyssen sobre le sieu cap, deysen a lu la segondina, e es mondada de aquelas superfluitatz am bona mondificacio.	Therefore, when you observe these signs, you will know that her belly is compressed due to the child's descent, and as it shifts onto its head, it signals the onset of the second stage, and it is cleansed of those superfluities with good purification.
Mays aquel que es otra aquest part es no-natural e no-lausable, quar quan le enbrio es eyssit sobre sos pes e·l cos de lu es eyssit devant le cap de lu e·ls pes de lu, e la ma de lu una, o al pe de lu i, o es eyssit le cap de lu e la ma de lu, o al ventre de lu, e fort leu es convertit sobre le sieu col, e semblant de las figuras de lu no-lausablas.	Anyone who claims otherwise about this labor is mistaken, for when the child is positioned on its feet and the mother's body is placed behind the child's head and her legs are either above or below the child's feet, or the child's head and mother's hand are positioned in front of her, or she is in strong contractions over her pelvis—all of these signs point to an unfavourable figure that is not commendable.

E aprop empelleys le fet a las partidas dedintz entro que pauses aquel segon que cove, e manda a la femna que comprema a si alcunas veguadas, e el sira fora-getat am eyssiment leugier, si Dieus o vol.	And then gently pull the hernia out until it stops at the right place, and order the woman to compress it periodically, and if God wills, it will be removed easily.
Exitus geminorum aut foetuum multorum.	The outcome of twins or multiple fetuses.
Sapias que gemels motas veguadas so natz, e alcunas vetz naysso tres o quatre , mays aquo es estranh e tart s’endeve; mays v so causas foro natura, e no vivo. And for those cases, whether they are multiples, a second one, and they are separated by the number (or measure), distinguish them by cutting through the ligament in the navel of each; some pregnancies are lost this way as if it were a lighter natural element, but some pregnancies are lost due to an unstoppable process.

E si’ la matrona subtil e fassa aquo que fa am facilitat e subtilitat, e am tarditat, e sia ingeniat segon tota figura segon que es a lu preparat de l’engen amenant a salut.	And if the midwife is skilled and does what makes it easy and subtle, delays it, and uses ingenuity according to every form as it prepares the body for the bringing of health.
Rememoratio eius quod formatur in matrice ex embrionibus et Abortiuntur.	Remembrance that it is formed in the womb from embryos and aborted.
Alcunas veguadas son formatz en la mayre un, e dos, e tres, e quatre, e v, e vi, e vii, e mays x, e ja es deves mi verificat que una femna abortem ne getet vi, e una autra x totz formatz, la qual causa fo fayta per mensuracio dels glorios savis. De extraccio del fet quan es mort.	On removal of the dead fetus.
Quan tu curas le fet mort am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la medicacio e no es defora eyssit, e tu yest forsat usar de opperacio am ma, lahoras cove que consideras si la femna es de sana vertut e no es am alcu dels accidentz per les quals sobre ela es temuda perdicio. E·l ministre tengua aquela de doas partz o sia liada en le lieyt per so que·l cos de lu no se extenda deves la extraccio del fet.	And the midwife must hold both parts or be placed on the bed to prevent her body from extending during the extraction of the fetus.

Ans sia maugut a tota partida, per so que l’eyssiment de lu sia alleujat ayssi cum es fayt en dent deves la eradicacio de lu.	And consider it at every step, so that the emergence of the hernia is alleviated as it is done in dental surgery for the eradication of a tooth.

So if the baby's part is expelled, then the cuts will be changed to another place where there is pus or better; and do this until all the baby is expelled.
Mays si la ma es eyssida denant l’autra, e no es possible reduzir aquela per la coartacio de lu, lahoras cove que drap sia envolopat sobre aquela; e aprop extratz aquela entro que tota sia fora-getada, e inscideys aquela o en la junctura de la ma o en le coyde.	If the hand is frozen against the other and it cannot be reduced due to its stiffness, then a cloth should be wrapped around it; then extract that part until everything is removed, and cut it either at the joint of the hand or at the elbow.

De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	On the treatment of fistulas that have resulted.

De curacio de fistulas.	**Curing Fistulas**
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Various occasions arise due to the drying out of fissures or the narrowing of openings naturally.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas. De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	The treatment of hernia is crucial.

Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	May you sterilize those in the solutions of intestinal troubles and the extraction of their pain, then apply the cautery until it is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if there are hemorrhoids or fistulas in the anus that cause pain, then use a delicate and gentle cauterization, as the cautery tools of which children are taught.
De curacio de las plaguas.	**On the Cure for Plagues**
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	You have already spoken about the division of the cure for plagues according to disposition, and you have thus indicated the cure for some by means of diet, and for others by the use of medicines according to their strength.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore, it is said that plagues are diverse according to the cause of the plague and according to the place where the plague strikes.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes for which you become ill are due to plagues thus with the weight of stone, or incision of space or of bone, or percussion with lance, or with club, or with arrow, or similar to those causes that bring on motion sickness.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	The plagues that are in the parts of the body may be such as a plague that sits on the head, or the neck, or the foot, or the belly, or the back, and similar to those of the members.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And it is often recommended for the treatment of certain plagues, to stop that reasoning and regulate concerning other plagues.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And one should begin with the simple plagues of the head, since the remembrance of the composite ones will come at the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore, it is said that when a simple plague occurs in the head and it is not a fracture, consider: if it is due to the weight of stone or similar, and you have already bitten the tongue deeply and it is a great plague and you fear the patient will fall into apostema (a state of extreme physical or mental deterioration), then you should immediately perform a trepanation (drilling a hole in the skull) and do not delay; and extract the foreign body from the sinus according to the quantity of strength it exerts, if no other cause prohibits trepanation, especially if the sinus affected by the plague is small.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And this is the surgical procedure, opposite to the affected part; and care must be taken against repletion and heavy foods and drinks.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	If due to weakness or any other reason, reducing food intake is necessary, then avoid meat and wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And in the case of an infected ulcer, if it is deep, apply a small piece of roasted olive oil or wine that has been strained.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	If it is certain that the ulcer is infected, then apply a poultice to it, if it is fresh with its own pus and the air has not changed the powder recommended, gently press it.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has changed it, then apply different poultices until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	If the wound is large or due to an incision of space and similar, and the lips of the hernia are not properly adjusted for closure, adjust them with sutures as I have recommended in their suture.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	If the hernia has already been discovered and is not retained by any structure but instead is a small suspender, then incise it and, as soon as possible, treat the hernia with medicines and restore the flesh appropriately in that area, and direct the patient to abstain from foods that are harsh: fruits and vegetables of a similar kind, until it heals.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find in the hernia putrefaction that does not adhere to the bone, then you should incise and remove all of it, and then treat it.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	If these hernias are due to an artery or vein from which pus flows and they do not subside with medicines, then inquire about the artery; if you find one that is not incised, incise it, or tie it off; and if, in the process, the pus does not drain, then cauterize it.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these plagues are simple and small, their cause is easily identifiable; so much so that you sprinkle this powder over them, as the powder hardens before the air changes them.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	The method of the powder is this: take olive oil from broken sesame seeds, dragon's blood divided into two parts, and frankincense divided into three parts; mix them all together finely and fill the plague with it, then tightly constrict it so that it adheres well to the affected area, and coagulate it with the dragon's blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	Then tighten it from above with poultices and leave it, without stirring it, as long as it is not infected; for the medicine will not be absorbed into it until it is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	Sometimes it is done alone with this remedy, when you do not have access to sesame seeds and dragon's blood.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And now performs this surgical procedure on the large abscesses when it is appropriate to stop them and tighten them, and they are fresh with their pus, which the air has not altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	If the air has altered them, especially in summer, one cannot understand the position of this powder, so apply what we have said, either by placing on the affected parts a paste made from ingredients such as egg yolks or by applying to the inflamed joints flour mixed with honey and water until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	If it happens that the abscess breaks in a bone and is small, then extract it with your fingers.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And tell the treatment for fractures of the skull in cases that are dangerous.
De las plaguas del col.	Of the abscesses of the collarbone.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	If the plague occurs in the colon, it is not different in treatment, nor between the plague of the head when it is simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	If the nerves of the colon are incised or an artery, then if it is nerves, there is no need for complex treatment but rather to avoid cure by something that causes violent spasms, likewise using herbs and similar things to relax them and prevent contraction.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And it does not matter what the cause of the pain is, for the substance of the nerves is compressed and their continuity is to the brain, which is the source of all members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if it is treated with lighter medicines, also with washing using two types of water, sometimes with oil or without oil, and drying when washed with hot water and other remedies afterwards according to this method, and then moisture is added.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	If the plague is severe, then administer a stitch, or tie the edges together, and soon after treat it with poultices until it heals.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	If the plague is deep or causes pus to form in a low and closed part of the body, then perforate it in the most vulnerable spot.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	If the plague has already cut into an artery and blood flow results, then separate or dry it, tie it off, or cauterize it if that is required to stop it.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	If the spine in the throat or completely cut, but the veins in the neck are saved, then secure the edges of the wound with stitches over the throat's cane and do not touch that part; later equalize that and return it to its natural shape, and appropriately tighten it with decent stretch, and leave it for several days; and treat it with ointment in places where there is stiffness and excitation until it heals.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	If the plague has already taken hold in the bone, then you should probe it and, if it contains pieces of bone, extract as many as possible; leave what is not attached so that the plague can disperse and its removal from the body be facilitated.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the plague is recent, then sprinkle that powder which has been recommended over it.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	If the plague has caused a fistula, then treat it with water from the source of its origin, which will be discussed in its respective chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Regarding the plagues of the collarbone or similar when they arise between the shoulders and are caused by a bruise, cut, or lance, or any other similar injury.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a wound from a lance or a cut, and the depth of it can be seen, then consider more carefully the plague's symptoms as the illness progresses; you should know that the plague is deadly.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if there is no depth in it and the wound is recent, then you should apply dust to it from the first hour, and do not press on it so that the wound is not retained in depth and returns to the heart and causes harm to the malady, but rather apply a soothing ointment to it twice a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if you do not have a suitable ointment, then apply clean cloth to the wound's surface so that it absorbs what comes from moisture; and make the malady rest on the wound so that whatever is appropriate runs into it.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	If after three days or more the wound has healed without causing spasms or tremors in the heart and no constriction of the blood vessels, and other good dispositions appear, then you will know that the wound is cured; and thereafter treat it with cold compresses and other remedies until it is completely healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	If the healing of the wound is delayed, and it remains open for a long time, then you will know that a fistula has formed; therefore, treat it according to its nature.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the wound is due to incision of space or bone, and it is simple on the surface of the foot or back, treat it with the method previously described for stitching, if it is large, or with powder, if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if the treatment has not worked on the bone, and you have already incised and extracted pieces, then turn to the wound, and try to extract those pieces if they are separated.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	If they are not separated, then leave them inside, as the extraction of them delays healing of the wound.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for other wounds that occur in the other parts of the body, the young (or quick) healing in treatment is what we have mentioned.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of abdominal wounds.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The disorder that occurs in the belly can be great, or small, or intermediate.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	From some great observations, one sees the intestine or hernia, so that its intrusion and the suture of it are either very violent or very subtle.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And a small disruption is difficult to achieve in another way, and I know that the reduction of them is more difficult if one does not address their intrusion into their place as soon as possible, because it opens up and thickens so that the insertion of them becomes difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	Therefore the best disruption is intermediate, because in that case the reduction of the hernia is neither difficult, as it is in the two aforementioned types.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And you know that the suture of the belly is according to four ways, but two sutures are common that suit in the sutures of other ailments of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other wounds communicate with the others, yet they are more specific to the wound of the abdomen.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I recommend to each of you exposition and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore, it says when the wound is small and there is no apparent cause in the abdomen for it, and it becomes difficult to reduce, then this is in one of two ways: either due to the narrowness of the disruption as we have said, or when the hernia has swelled up due to the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when it is so, then know that you should bind it thus, immersing a sponge or cloth in warm water, or taking watercress, fennel, and spices, and wrapping them around the hernia until the swelling is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And in some cases, it has been observed that vinegar is more effective than water alone in resolving inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And once you have resolved the inflammation, moisten the hernia with water in which herbs like althae and mulleins are steeped, for they help to relax its contents slightly.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	However, if the contents of the hernia cannot be reduced by this treatment, then you may need to cut the disruption using a small instrument with which hemorrhoids are incised.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the initial treatment is better when it involves no cutting, and there is no need to dry it abruptly, but only a gradual supply of nutrition.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Regarding the instrument, see its form:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	In one part of the acute pain, and in another part not acute, and at the delicate extremity, let there be no subtlety of space; first make it slightly obtuse.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore, when the hernia is enlarged and it has protruded, you must return it to its natural form and position, in its proper place, if possible; for this is better.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	If the hernia is extensive and located in the lower part of the abdomen, you must make the patient lie on their back, and raise their legs higher than their head; but if it is located in the upper part of the abdomen, then you must elevate the patient's head and feet higher than the hernial openings.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And similarly, if the hernia is in one of the two parts of the abdomen, you must always direct your intention and consideration towards making the affected part higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And also ensure that you administer this in large and small pains.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in the smaller pains, apply what you have prepared, and then make the medicine flow between your fingers, hold it with your hand, and adjust the edges of the wound, and then gradually uncover from one part to another, searching for any cause that might be hidden, other than the suture.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common method of suturing: take the needle, or count one needle according to the amount of the width of the wound; then lay it at the edge of the disruption on the little finger, and tighten the needle once; avoid putting any pressure on both ends of the thread, except for the two ends that remain within the wound, as you make the needle penetrate from one side to the other; and when you have added both ends of the thread and both ends of the needle, they form four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And then tightly wrap the thread double around the needle, sometimes from two sides together, and add both lips and the wound by a decent addition; and leave the thickness of the thread and tie another needle to it, just as if it were the first needle; and do not cease doing this for the needles until you have fully resolved the contraction of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And the needles should be of varying thicknesses, between coarse and fine, for the thin needles pierce the flesh slightly; the thick ones are difficult to insert into the wound, therefore they should be of a moderate thickness in both respects.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it is important that the needle be inserted into both ends of the hernia at once, so that the flesh is not pierced too deeply and the hernia opens up before its hardening.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And the stitches should not be too long, so that the hernia is not hindered from healing.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then carefully insert the ends of the needles so as not to cause further harm to the patient during their sleep; rest upon the wound pulvils spread out from all sides, which have the ends of the needles; and leave them there until you know that the illness is consolidated.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And these types of sutures with needles are most convenient in small wounds, as they can be applied to the suture using just one needle, or two, or even more around them.

And if the wound is not clean and flows as it should, you will know that you have not achieved the complete eradication of corruption; then uncover it again and carefully perform the reason for its treatment and purification with the last strengthening force, and then restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And therefore if it is clean, then it is good; but if not, you will know that this corruption is in the deep, distant parts of the body, which has not been reached, and thus your effort in that place is only to wash it.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the corrupt bone is small, or it is within your power to throw it away, then throw it with subtle forceps that are suitable for this.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if there are many bones, carefully perform the extraction of all of them, and from none of them leave any cause for your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	If any cause of discomfort arises from moisture, and upon examining it there is no fear or mistake, then incise those inflamed or fleshly parts, and dislocate the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	If you do not have the skill to extract bones from your patient, then focus on the affected area where the problem originated, and leave it until you can safely remove the infection; ensure that the wound remains open while you wait for the infection to heal, and be careful not to constrict the section you incised during your operation.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Previously, if you are hesitant, apply a hot compress or one soaked in olive oil, or with Egyptian bitter water, or any of the green oils, for when these inflammations subside, and the bones can be separated from their adhesion, and this attraction is alleviated.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	If it is a large bone such as a thigh or leg bone or similar, and the corruption affects only its outer part, then carefully cut away this corrupted portion, but do not remove the whole limb; restore the wound by repairing its blackened and corrupted state.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	If the part that is corrupt is great, and the corruption has already reached the marrow of the bone, then it becomes necessary to close and completely cut out that part in the place where the corruption has occurred, and once it is healed, treat it.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I recommend to you that you enter into the patient's thigh to hold that in place, serving as an example and assistant to your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	A young man around XXX years old experiences pain in his thigh, and the pain arises from within due to an infection of the deep tissues of the body until it reaches the thigh, it is a matter of apoplexy or a great apoplexy, and not caused by an external factor.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And therefore, the duration of his suffering increases due to the error of the doctors, as the apoplexy expands, and pus-filled matter accumulates, and his treatment is prolonged until the leg becomes fistulated, causing terrible wounds that can penetrate and affect the body's moisture.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And thus many doctors have treated it for about two years, not focusing on the knowledge but on the art, since that is how you are called.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And I saw the hernia and the substances that were flowing from it through these terrible pains; and already the condition of that man was entirely stabilized, and the color of him was citron-like.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And thus you insert the probe into one of these hernias and conquer the probe with the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	Then you carefully examine all the hernias and find those that are causing trouble from every part of the hernia.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	And thus you carefully cut and incise over one of these hernias until you discover a part of the bone, and you find that it is corrupted, hard, and degenerated; and already a part of the hernia was rotten, corrupted, and destroyed within as the material had penetrated into the mesenteries.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then you secure what I have discovered and prepared from the exposed bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I believed that it was not in the bone but that corruption which I had removed and secured, and I had already washed it away.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	Then I will pause the restoration of the disease with curative medicines for a long time, and it is not consolidated.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	Then I will repeat and uncover over the bone according to the first discovery, and seek any continuing corruption in the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I will secure what appears to me as that corruption, and then I will make holes in it to effect the cure and restoration, but it is not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then I will uncover it again, and I will not cease to carefully cut the bone little by little and perforate the restoration of it, but it is not restored until I cut around a palm of it, and extract that from its marrow, and then restore it with medicines, and it is slightly strengthened and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And further surgery of it and its removal is not necessary unless for the arrangement of its fragility and the scarcity of its tolerance, and fear of death, because it becomes weak at all times due to excessive evacuation leading to fainting.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And thus health is achieved through complete healing, and nothing is in place of the hard bone; its arrangement in the body is good and returns its virtue; it is adjusted to its dispositions, and causes no opposition in walking or harm from any cause.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	If indeed the bone protrudes from the body, then you should act as follows: take lint and tightly wrap that around the end of the protruding bone, and ask someone to extend it; then wrap a thicker lint over the first one; next, place this lint on the flesh left by the bone, and extend the tip so that you can pull the flesh away from the joints below, and uncover the flesh where you want to make the cut, so that the saw does not harm the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And place a knife or table beneath the bone, for when you do this, the saw is not hindered from cutting through the corrupt flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And be careful with the sawing over the corrupt place little by little, for if the corruption is in the concave of the bone and does not appear in its sensation, you must force the saw another time.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	If the bone is corrupt and not prominent, it is sometimes a continuous separation from one side to the other, and the corruption is in the middle or in part of it, then you must expose the flesh from all parts; and place a knife beneath, and saw first the one that has the corruption while continuing the sawing of the other part.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And the sawing should be according to the location of the corruption, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, cut through that corrupt joint, and bind the bone where it continues from the other side.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the connection of two joints, then it is not in their ratio but requires skill.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the chest of the hand or foot, it is very difficult; nevertheless, you must investigate where the corruption appears to you, and open it up, and remove it according to any possible disposition that is at your command, and with skill correct any deformity that does not cause you pain or affect nerves.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And you should know which saws and chisels are suitable for cutting these bones, as they depend very much on the position of the bones, and their preparation, and their thickness, and their subtlety, and size, and smallness, and hardness, and rarity; so that it is necessary to prepare all kinds of instruments suitable for any operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And you will know that this operation signifies to you regarding the nature of the instrument of which you stand in need; since you possess great learning and experience in the methods of this art, and are a witness to the ways of various ailments, at this time you will have understood what is appropriate for it among instruments for any ailment.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And in the end of this chapter, you will learn the number of instruments which you will use with examples as you proceed with your training, the very same tools that you will employ according to your experience gained from others.
