E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And the end of it is triangular and of sharp point.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian steel, and in appearance it covers all the causes that we have mentioned of razors and scissors and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of the incision of the extreme points and of the locking of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities may be affected either intrinsically or extrinsically, or if, after treating that corruption with those remedies, the cure does not follow, or if the corruption continues to spread to other parts that do not suffer from any cause, then you must know that you should cut off that member within which this evil spreads, so that it may escape death or great harm to that part.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that which happens is that the member becomes black where it has been cut, since fire had consumed it, or if you see the darkness increasing until it affects that part of the body which was once healthy and now consumes the entire body; therefore, make an incision on that.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And it seems to be caused by the corruption and impact of certain poisonous sources, such as from a scorpion's sting or a viper or nettle, and similar things.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or impact is on the end of the finger, you make an incision into the finger and do not give space to the corruption so that it does not spread to the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And if it seems to affect the hand, then you make an incision at the root of the finger, and do not give space to the corruption until it takes over the entire finger of the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if you change your mind, then incise the arm inside the elbow at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if another corruption or change surrounds the elbow, then that is the death of the patient; and to treat another cause related to it in healing requires a great deal of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly, if there is corruption in the foot, then do as you would with an elbow, incising it inside one of the joints.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if you take hold of the foot's edge, then incise the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	If it is possible to enter within the toe, then incise the leg inside the joint of the toe.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already spread to the toe, then it offers no cure but dismissal, leaving the patient to die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the method of incising or cutting off a member is that you tighten the ligament at the part which you wish to cut, and tighten another ligament over it; then extend the instrument a ligament between the parts left, and extend the minister another ligament on them; and separate the flesh which is between two ligaments without any space until all the flesh is discovered; and then it is incised or cut off.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And cover it with cloth from all sides to prevent any contact with the area, and ensure the patient's injury is aligned and healed carefully.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	If bleeding occurs during the operation, you cauterize the area carefully, or apply some powders to constrict the blood flow; and then return to your treatment until it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then attach the affected member with ligaments appropriately, and treat it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I advise you to take a man in his foot, this accident which you and I have recommended, which is caused by the heat turning black on his foot resembling the burn of fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption is first caused in the inside of the foot, which tends to spread throughout the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepares himself for this treatment, as he sees the cure going to the member with the violence of his pain and heat, and he cuts into the foot at the joint, and fire heals.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	Long ago, that treatment of this corruption in the foot's arch became indicated.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then it overcomes me, and so I perforate the accumulation to reflect that superfluity with water that stops the flow of medicine, appropriating the purification of the body; and the superfluity is not reflected, and we begin to go to the other arch within that we began in the foot.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And the surgeon insists on incising the patient's hand, and I do not want to do it fearing the consequences of that superfluity, for if you do not hold back, the incision in the patient's hand will be mortal, as the virtue of the malady was about to cease.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And since he departed from me, he returned to his land and forced me to prepare and incision in the man's hand entirely, and he healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not related this story merely to assist those who suffer from this malady, but also to explain its cause and how it should be treated.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	On the treatment of fever and the quality of enemas with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in some fleshy part of the body and the space of the abscess is prolonged so as to form a collection of pus, then it is cut open and discharged, and the place remains hollow as if it were a vessel, and the skin above it is relaxed, and no further corruption penetrates, and does not affect the bone or nerves or ligaments, it is called a fever, and is not named a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the space is prolonged such that the corruption encompasses an entire member, it is then called a fistula and not incurable.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the cure for it is to incise that entire cord as it is twisted, especially when it has become subtle and is made with a thread, and ensure that it does not adhere to the area due to its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	If you hope that the cord does not adhere and that that corruption does not continue due to its last consequences, and if the cord has passed through the wall, then cure it with a cloth enema.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And it is that you consider the sinuses, and if they are large, and the arm that has them emits a foul odor, then enema with Egyptian medicine made of oil, wine, and spices, adjusted in a vessel, and heated over fire until the medicine becomes hot and reaches the desired strength.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then take from him what is necessary and dissolve it in water and honey; cleanse the affected sinus with it, tighten the orifices of the foot, and leave the medicine on it for two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then extract that precious substance; do this for as many days until the sinus is cleansed and the pain is alleviated.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	In some cases, the sinus is cleansed with water from ashes, when this medicine is not available to you; take ash from a fireplace, mix it with water, and use that to cleanse the sinus until you feel that it has been cleared.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	If the patient is intolerant to Egyptian medicine or ash water, then cleanse the sinus with water and honey, mixed with a third part of cinnamon; or with wine and honey, for the honey cleanses and washes, while the wine helps adhere to the sinus, especially when there is an excess of stiffness and dryness from previous treatments.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And after you have done this several times and feel that the swelling has gone down, then cleanse that area with water that helps bring forth the flesh's humors.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And indeed, you should take a mixture of dyaphinic (a medicinal substance) and dissolve that oily crust and apply it firmly; or cleanse that area with some medicines in enguent (a paste-like preparation) and others that have the properties which I have already described in the treatise on enguents.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifices of the swelling are tight through which the catheter of the cleister cannot pass, then gradually enlarge them with a small iron, and apply heat wrapped in Egyptian or basilicon enguent until they are enlarged.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And if the orifices seem to be wide enough, then you should suture the edges of them and leave as much quantity of them open as is needed for the cleister to pass through.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the orifice through which the arm passes is elevated above its attachment, then dry it in the lowest place on the patient, where the arm runs between, for when the arm is compressed in the depth of the shoulder, flesh is generated within it.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible to dry the shoulder socket within the environment of the bone at a lower place as you wish, then pierce and prepare the member so that the arm can run from it lightly according to what you have prepared and without any cause for the arm to be retained.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidating medicines that are gently applied over the shoulder, appropriately adjusting those on a cloth to extend them over the area.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth should be of such a large quantity as to allow for complete coverage of the shoulder; then, using scissors, cut them along the right side of the shoulder socket opening slightly wider than the shoulder socket itself; extend another piece of cloth soaked in ointment over it according to the size of the opening, and place it on top of the previous one at a distance from the shoulder socket so that the arm's movement is not hindered by the large cloth and it does not adhere for too long.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	He who is above the opening of the sinus, which purges at all times so as to draw out what is retained in it from the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you may know if what flows from the arm is much or little, or digested or undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And thus consider the location of that sinus, whether or not the patient feels pain in it, and if there is an abscess in it.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your treatment is prolonged in this manner, and you see that the matter discharged from the sinus opening has become adhered, or a strong adhesion has formed, then pull it gently on the third day, and when you remove the pain, change the bandage for another one and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	If from the sinus a subtle, thin space is opened, do not be alarmed by the adhesion of it, for healing itself takes place, for sometimes it generates new flesh in the patient's wounds, and others experience the opposite.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if a brash indigestion persists for several days, you will know that the intestines do not adhere; and if the adhesion of the intestines is prolonged, then adjust the treatment with drying medicines, for if the medicines are moist in their substance and virtue, they should be dried as with an astringent when there is too much superfluity added to them.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the last part of the treatment is to take a drying agent and dissolve it in rose oil, and then apply it to the affected area, and wrap it tightly, and use it as directed.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And it seems to work even when there is no pain: take a drying agent, honey, if it is thin, use it; or take myrrh and aloe vera, mix them together and grind them into powder over fire, wrap this in cloth and apply it tightly to the intestines; and also wrap that with the honey you have noticed as thickening, and sprinkle that on the cloth and press it.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And some times they administer to him long extracts and roots of celestial lilies (celestial lilies), and flour of nettle and centaury, and use these simples either pure or mixed, triturate them and sieve and sprinkle over honey which has been recomposed; and apply it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the pain persists and is not alleviated by this treatment, you will know that the corruption is in the innards of the patient, and it has affected the bones or other hard members or their connections; then you treat it with a fistular remedy, as is said above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	On the treatment of nail infections, calluses, and the addition of cuts to the finger, and its amputation.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Panarici (calluses) is an apostema (infection) that arises from the nail of the finger or toe, and it strongly affects other digits as well. When prolonged without treatment, it becomes more serious, either through cauterization or corruption. It emits a brash within that corrodes the root of the nail, and it can corrupt the entire nail, reaching the bone inside, causing a foul odor. The extremity of the finger is affected, and its color turns dark.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And therefore when you have attended to what we have mentioned in the previous section and do not confirm your treatment, remember that you must incise with a sharp instrument all the superfluity that is collected in the joint and then cauterize the wound nearby, for cautery brings relief to such things.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If the bone is strong and the joint is healthy, but the additional fluid in the joint causes the flesh to be squeezed from within, and you begin to puncture and hurt it, remember that you should make a slight cut at the angle of the joint that punctures the flesh, and push it aside, cutting the flesh easily, and apply something over it containing medicinal, corrosive substances until everything is completely removed; then treat it with ointment until it heals.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	If the corruption has already penetrated into the bone, remember that you must cut into the bone and extract it, for never is a bone healed when it is corrupted within.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If rust and corruption are present in the said part, then you incise it into one of the nuts according to memory, and subsequently treat it so that it heals.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	If there is an urgent need for percussion or scraping and the pain is intense, then begin by applying fleebotomes to the affected area, and carefully dry the nail with a sharp, transverse section just above it, ensuring that the cut does not penetrate the surrounding flesh, as this could cause severe pain and lead to the growth of excess tissue at the site; subsequently, treat the area to alleviate the pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	However, this adjustment, which is natural in the bodies of many people, is characterized by a high proportion of flesh, or conversely, a predominance of bones, or yet again, a thick nail bed.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	Some of them are born in the joints, or it is their nature to be present in certain nuts of the body.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	He who is born into certain ignorance of this knowledge will not suffer, but he who is born with weak joints is easily afflicted.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And of those who are born fleshy, the incision is slight, and you must insert your blade into their flesh at a shallow angle.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	He who is born with the disease of the joint, treatment is difficult; therefore, guard against the excision of it.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	In the case of those born with such ignorance, take care to make an incision at the beginning in their flesh around the bone with a round blade, and then use a suitable saw to close it, and be sure that it heals properly.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	In the consolidation that occurs between the joints due to various occasions or by nature in a person who does not have them, or due to hernia or fire burn, or similar, then take care to remove that consolidation so that the joints return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And then place between their sheets some warmed oil so that the joints do not harden too quickly, and separate them with a thin lead sheet until they are consolidated as required.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And if similar consolidation occurs on the palm, then dry that consolidation according to what is prepared and suitable for the shape of the member.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Regarding the incision of veins, there are varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Veins, when they become varicose, are thick, twisted veins filled with excessive melancholic fluid, which occur most commonly in the legs, especially in the calves of those who walk, work, or carry heavy loads.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	So then, you will understand that you must administer a purge to the body from black choler at certain times with a strong expulsion, and also draw blood from the patient's basil vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The treatment of their pain is according to two methods: one is to incise and drain that black blood, and the other method is to raise the vein and extract all of it.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The incision is made according to this method: first, the leg is soaked in hot water until the thick blood clot is dissolved, which is foul-smelling from the leg, then firmly hold the patient's thigh at the superior part of the wound with a bandage, and make an incision in one, two, or three places along the vein, and raise the black blood clot using the upper part of the leg above the wound, until all the quantity desired is extracted, as much as necessary, and which the patient can endure.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then bind it tightly, and order the patient to abstain from cold foods that generate black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the treatment through phlebotomy when the veins are filled and this causes pain to the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	May the elevation of their legs be done in this manner: you who raise the leg of the patient, if there is much hair on it, then immerse it in water and soak the leg with warm water until the swelling goes down and the veins are relaxed; or if it has been exercised by a strong exertion, then bathe it as soon as possible while the member is still warm.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	Then open the vein at the right place, either along its length or at the very end, or at the lowest part of it, and remove the blood.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	Then cut the vein with scissors and remove it from all parts until it disappears, and you must observe the color of it; if it declines to blackness, that is a sign of grave illness.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And therefore, after you have removed the vein and the blood, examine that white part to see if there is any hardness.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then you insert your fingers into the space so that it is raised and freed from the tie, and suspend those with hot clay or lion's dung.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	Then make another incision, perpendicular to the first, and carefully cut the tie away from the vein until it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	Then raise that one and incise it in the rear section, after the leg, extract it and raise it until it comes out through the second incision, and extract it from the section above that one.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do this until you extract the one from the highest or most superior section of all the incisions, ensuring that all are drained, and then incise it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you fail to extract and raise it, then insert a strong, double-threaded needle into the space and draw it out, or insert your fingers into the space and turn your hand over until it is freed.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And be careful not to cut; for if it is broken, it is difficult to raise that part and it comes back to the patient through that damage.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And once everything has been removed, apply to the affected area a mixture of vinegar and rose oil and unmixed oil, and treat that until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the vein is contracted without twisting in which it is wrapped, and not straight according to what we have said, then you must cut into that part of its entire tortuosity and at the places where it wraps itself, and with a stitch raise that whole thing.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And be careful not to cut the vein and do not damage it, for it will be difficult to raise that; and use your discretion in that.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The form of the injury which is dried out:
Forma de unci orp:	The form of the wound:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not as sharp as with wounds, nor does it have an acute extremity so as not to damage the vein; and it has a thick flexibility, because if it were too thin, it would pierce the vein due to its thinness; it has a superfluous thickness as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Of the extraction of the vein of the thigh.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs in hot regions, as well as in the hernia on Arabic land and in the hot, dry lands of India with little greenery or openness.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And very few are generated in other parts of the body, other than the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And the process of putrefaction occurs when cold humors infiltrate the body, bringing serpents and worms and parasites that are born between the feces and flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And the sign of the impending arrival of gout is this: what happens in the leg is a violent inflammation; then the place becomes sore; and soon the vein begins to leave the area of that soreness, which seems torn from the plant itself.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And when the gouty inflammation appears, you will see that it envelops a part of the leg like a piece of lead from which a dragon's weight would hang. Within this dragon, there is a space, and you should notice and leave the lead suspended from the leg.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And on many occasions, when you encounter some unknown cause of this pain outside the body, you should envelop it in lead and note that.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if the movement persists, you cut a part of it and wrap the wound; do not incise the deep one until it is completely detached, for if you do, it will contract and penetrate into the flesh, causing abscesses, gangrene in the area, and bad ulcers.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	As the treatment progresses and it is extracted little by little, make sure that it completely comes out from behind (the affected area) and do not leave any cause of it remaining in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein, some men are affected in its length reaching up to their wrists and even beyond; it has also been observed that I have seen one case where it extended for 10 palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised during treatment, insert the ray into the channel of the vein and pierce that long channel in the flesh, so that all that is in the matter is evacuated, and apply putrefaction to the place for some days with medicines; then take care of it for the cure of abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein is sometimes seen with great swelling, especially when it appears at the joint of the foot or on the foot, and it causes much painful sensation, and is derived from every painful point.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And therefore, treat that as we have said in the division and refer to what is mentioned above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	From the section about worms generated under the skin, and it is called bovine itching.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This malady is called bovine itching in many lands, because it causes great distress to the animal; it is caused by a small worm that is born between the skin and flesh, and it affects all over the body, pushing and weakening (the muscles and tissue), and its manifestation appears first in the withdrawal of the limbs until it ruptures the skin and lets out the worm.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And the generation of these worms is due to the corruption of certain humors, which cause worms and snakes and roundworms and tapeworms in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared by the evil of it, for when it enters the body and rises to the head, it reaches the eyes, severely affecting them and even destroying them, which should be prevented.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And therefore when you want to cure it and extract it, you must not do so unless you understand its movement and appearance in the body, and then grasp what is above it and what remains below it with strong compression, and afterwards dry it and extract that which is inside it.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is embedded in the flesh and does not disturb you, then place a hot cautery over the place where it resides, and the main cause that is feared is the corruption of it which also corrupts the place as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	If it affects the eyes or their vicinity, then tighten the upper eyelid with strong pressure, dry it and extract that which is inside; and know that this malady uses purification of the body through medicines that evacuate corrupt, bad humors, and beware of foods causing putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	On cutting away from the disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is called "nafir" in our land, and it is pain that appears in some members, and then it changes from one member to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And you have already seen that second one that I recommended.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	You were called to attend a female patient in a village, and upon examining her arm, you discovered a small inflammation in the vein at the wrist, which had been broken for an hour. As it was healing, you noticed that the inflammation moved from one place to another, appearing almost like living silver as it spread from one location to another.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then he removed the pain from that place and applied pressure to the muscle, holding it for an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then correct in the other body until you reach the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And then I found myself turning over the body, examining it entirely as I had seen; and I was too amazed by the permutation of the illness and by the speed with which it moved from one member to another.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had already seen this in my own feet according to that manner, however, I have seen many which cause severe pain to be changed from one member to another.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	You do not see this in the feet of women as well.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I do not think that this is for any other reason than because the woman was old, with dry skin and exposed veins, and in this condition, the sensation of that changed wind appears.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that this retrospective cure not be apparent in those who are weak and have a moist body with veins close to the surface.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And if you wish to cure the patient and they feel that pain, then it is not apparent as we have said, but you should strengthen over that area and gently pull it, and let it rest, and apply heat to that place until that airiness is reduced, and cauterize the location.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	If you do not find them in your heels, then cure that by relieving the body and what expels airiness, and bind those with foul-smelling pills and pills of serpent and similar things.
De extraccio de sagetas.	From the extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are diverse according to their species and the parts of the body they pierce, for their diversity lies in that some have large tips, and small ones, and concave, and dull points, all of which are solid; and others have three angles, and others tongues, and still others barbs.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And according to the members and parts in which it strikes, it is divided into two manners: for the principal members, as the head, heart, liver, lungs, entrails, hernias, and bladder, are affected similarly; so when it catches any of these members and signals your death, which I will describe later, you must be aware to avoid extraction of that arrow from those parts where death is that which prevails in the most favorable conditions, and when these symptoms do not appear on you, and the arrow is not hidden deep within the member, then extract it and heal the disease.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And among the signs of the disease, it is when the arrow strikes in it and penetrates the bone, and a puff emerges from the cyphac (the part above the brain), due to the violent heat, causing scotoma (darkness in the field of vision), vertigo, pain in the legs, inflammation and pain in the tongue, spasms, confusion of speech, and vomiting of bile. When this is severe, word is cut off and voice is destroyed. From the affected area, a white humid discharge resembling powder emerges, and it feels like flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And if these signs appear to you, then abstain from treatment and extraction of the arrow, unless it is protruding.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	If the arrow enters the heart, so that it is close to the left nipple, and you feel a hard cause of pain, not visible; if the movement of the arrow is similar to the movement of the pulse, and the flow of black plague blood, and there is coldness in the extremities, and shortness of breath, and fainting; then know that death is at hand.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when the arrow has wounded the lung, appear as pus from the plague, and the vessels near the collarbone are inflamed, and there is a change in the patient's complexion, and they breathe heavily, and ask for fresh air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if the arrow strikes the tendon in the leg, and the pain is close to the small ribs, it causes great pain with violent sobs, and all the muscle members are not completely relaxed.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if the arrow strikes the stomach, then strong vomiting occurs from the undigested food.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if the arrow pierces the abdomen and becomes lodged there, it causes a tear in the organs, or tissue, or hernia, and there is no hope for its cure unless the arrow is removed.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow strikes the bladder and urine leaks out, it causes pain from some internal cause, and intense pain is felt by the patient; then you will know that it is fatal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	The other parts of the body, such as the face, neck, head, shoulders, elbows, back bones, hip joint, and legs, can also be saved according to proper disposition when the arrow does not strike a vein or artery and is not a poisonous arrow.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And now I will relate to you what I have observed about these arrows, so that you may understand their use in treatment.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The cause is that when an arrow strikes the lacrimal gland of a man in the root of his nose and it is extracted from him in another place, leaving the bones of his eyebrow intact, he recovers and there is no further damage to his nose.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And another arrow was extracted from a Jew, which had struck him in the bones of his nose, leaving the eyelid intact, and the arrow was concealed and could only be retrieved with a small extremity to which it adhered, and it was a large arrow among the sharp arrows of the Turks, capable of penetrating a lion without leaving an auricle.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew recovered, without any further damage to his nose.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And then extract another arrow from a Christian man who had been hit in the groin, which was an Arab arrow, and it is that one with feathers; and then I incise it between two guides, and it was already submerged in the patient's groin; and then I gently remove it, and thus the Christian is healed.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And I also extracted another arrow from a man who had been hit in his belly, and I thought he would die from it; so, after we had passed thirty days and nothing changed about his conditions, I incise the arrow and carefully removed it, and thus he was healed, without any further harm.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And I saw a man in whom an arrow had struck his back and the wound was deeply embedded; after applying fire nearby for some time, I pulled out the arrow at the base of the wound.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And I saw a woman in whom an arrow had struck her belly, and the wound was deeply embedded within, and it did not change in appearance for a long time, and the woman did not suffer much in any of her natural functions.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And he sees another man with an arrow in his face, the wound is deep and the arrow breaks, causing little pain but much similarity to these.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And they removed the arrow from the man of the king's princes who was wounded in the middle part of his nose and had already inclined to the right side a little, and the entire arrow was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And you were called upon for the cure, so close the wound of the arrow within three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	Then you should examine the wound of the arrow very closely; then you should inquire about that attempt subtly, and not feel it; but he felt a sharp pain leaving the right ear, and then hoped that this pain was due to the end of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And you applied the place with a plaster that is attractive and digestive, trusting that it would heal the location where the arrow was wounded, so that it would dry up over that.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And do not make any incision at the site of the accident that the arrow has reached; continue to apply poultice over it for several days and no accidents occur; as the wound consolidates, break up the pain from the extraction of the arrow in intervals of several days until one day you feel the arrow within its base and I reconnect it there.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then you should pause over the wound with acute corrosive medicine for several days until a fire opens up, and you should gently try to remove it, and cut back the tip of the arrow, which adheres to the wood.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	Then you should adjust the opening of the wound with that acute medicine until I visually see the tip of the arrow, and I spend time on it for intervals of time over four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	Then you should press that the wound becomes enlarged, and I attempt to insert scissors into it, and hold them, and do not be concerned about appearance. You will no longer need to subtilize and ingeniously devise methods on that account until one day through these ingenious methods, you manage to pull it out using forceps meticulously crafted, as the form of those will come at the end of this chapter, until I extract it; and then you should restore that wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some physicians judged that the nasal cartilage would not be restored, and they have restored it so that the disease is consolidated, and health is achieved throughout the body, and there will be no relapse in it for any reason.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recommend to you the quality of extraction of some arrows so that it maintains this rule and meaning regarding what I have not mentioned, for the parts of this art and the definitions of those others are not understood from the narrative nor do those comprehend the book.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the skilled artisans speak little about what is present and much about what is absent; and from what is presented, they infer what is absent; and they discover new operations and new instruments for the descent of foreign causes in the art when accidents occur.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	Therefore, you say that arrows are not expelled from the members in which they are inserted but according to two manners: either by attraction of the place where they enter; or on the contrary of the other part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is discharged from the place where it enters, or is a dart proceeding in fleshy places, and is thrown out and voided.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if you do not adhere to the timing of when cats are eaten, then know that you leave it for a few days so that the flesh around it decays and the attraction of it and its exit are alleviated.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And similarly, if it becomes stuck in the bones and you do not adhere to its prescribed eating timing, leave it for a few days, and on another day, repeat the process of discharge, and it will be voided out.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if you do not adhere to your prescribed eating every few days, then know that you must pierce the path of the dart in that bone, gradually widening the area where the dart is located, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if an arrow is embedded in the skull bone and has pierced one of the brain's cavities, causing some of those symptoms you described, then refrain from removing the arrow and leave it there for some days; for if the arrow reaches the brain, death will not be prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is not embedded in the bone but only in the flesh and does not pass into the brain, and after some days the patient recovers from those symptoms without any other cause related to them, then devise a way to attract the arrow and remove it.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	If it is deeply embedded and does not allow for its removal, then apply treatments around the arrow's path as we have recommended, and take care of the spot until it heals.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	If the arrow is already lodged in the body and is affecting a vital area, then examine that attempt, and if you feel any pain, use some suitable tools to attract and remove it.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot reach it due to the constriction of the plague and the length of the arrow, here there are neither nerves nor veins, then you must work on the plague until it is enlarged and it is possible to extract the arrow.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if there are ears attached that are stuck, then you must carefully cut away the flesh in which they are embedded from all sides using every possible tool; and devise a plan to remove the meat from the fracture of the ears and their twisting until it becomes easier.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you perform the extraction of the arrow in any place, then use your hand with forceps at all times to make it give way; and act with great subtlety so that the arrow is not broken and can be easily removed along with it.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada. And this ampoule is much larger than the one we have previously used, and its quantity is less depending on the illness and the state of the patient using it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the strength of the suction cups on children and the weak is different from the suction cups on young people and robust bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the method of stopping this suction cup is to apply a small amount of hot wax from a fire over it, and place another one in the middle of the transverse tongue at the exact spot of the suction cup, so that the flame is lit around the edge without burning the patient's body.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	Once the suction cup is removed from the patient's member, place a cloth over the mentioned area, and while we have the cups, do not remove them immediately but let the heat from the flame on that cloth gradually dissolve the suction cup.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And keep applying the heat according to your preference, repeating as needed.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	It is also possible to use a suction cup on patients with pleurisy, filled with water instead of air, without a transverse tongue or a tract, and it should only be placed over the member.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the form of it: And this windbag, the larger it is, the better, because it can receive a great quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	**Chapter LXXVII**
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz. E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those that you have found bloodletting instruments in the infected waters of putrid sores.

If bloodletting is prohibited, then the place should be rubbed with a recent wound or left with a needle in the area until it bleeds; and when they are stopped, for those who feel any pain soon afterwards, it will subside.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to stop bleeding, sprinkle some alum, salt, or ash onto it and press immediately.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the process of recovery from the third stage: restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is prompted frequently in the art of medicine; it deals with the restoration of broken and dislocated bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, child, know that those who boast of this chapter are foolish doctors and common people, and those who at any time have not studied the books of the Ancients or read a single letter from them.

Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque. Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	So, let us say in the prologue of this chapter the sums of speech; and the chapters to the understanding of which, at the beginning, the craftsmen are forced and obliged to dwell upon the truth of those; it is for you and for those who are prompt to know or learn this noble art from you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore it is said, when you encounter any fracture or dislocation or twist or misalignment, you must realize at the outset that you should begin with bloodletting or removal of that part, or in some instances, if no other cause prohibits, with the use of virtues, or it may be as it presents itself, or weak from decrepitude, or subject to violent heat, or intense friction.

And then, he should be content with his own diet of sharp herbs and lean meats and crabs; and refrain from thick meats and any foods that fill the veins with blood, as long as you are careful to avoid apoplexy, and if you do not fear the effusion of matter into the member.

E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And you should know that the bones become brittle when they are in old age or decrepitude, it is not possible for them to continue and be consolidated according to their nature due to the dehydration of their limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	They are consolidated and continue according to their nature as long as there is dehydration of those limbs, and they continue to be consolidated and strengthened in the end of old age, just like the bones of young children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	Nature nevertheless adjusts and amends the broken bone from any cause resembling gout in which there is swelling that adheres and strengthens that part, until it becomes solid and firm, as with fire at the beginning, whenever any cause does not prevent it from performing its works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason, it is necessary to restrict the diet of the patient, foods that have weight and viscosity and thickness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	The diversity of fractures varies according to the diversity of members.

And you should know that the species of fractures are diverse according to the diversity of members, for the fracture of a bone in the leg is different from the fracture of a bone in the head; and the fracture of a bone in the foot is distinct from the fracture of a bone in the arm; and similarly, all other members differ among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And now, I shall endeavor to translate your medieval medical text line by line:
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	A great variety of fractures requires different treatments.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And there are diverse species of bone fractures in their innards; for some are curved fractures or those that occur in them as stars; and sometimes they are fractured according to the length of the bone: such as stag and rib fractures, and additions proceeding and not proceeding, as is done in surgery when it is prepared to write, and fracture by plague and disruption on the head, and small fissure fracture.

Mota senhal de fractura del os.	A sign of bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And this is how bone fracture is known: the deformity of it, and that prominence and appreciation upon touch, and only from it when you compress it with your hand.

And you know that the location, when it is curved and does not split into two or anything else other than what naturally occurs in it, if the entire part of its comparison is disrupted, then you must begin with your hour to correct the curvature that has occurred in it with caution.

And be careful, according to your strength, not to harm the patient during your operation or cause any injury; and pierce as best you can, applying one bone to another in its most suitable way.

E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	Avoid excessive extension and compression, as foolish doctors often cause gangrene by such cauterization due to their operations, or they cause contraction in the member, as we have seen this happen through the operations of their moted (presumedly "motas" - instruments) attempts.

Then attach, apply, and carefully operate on and tighten that member, and provide rest and tranquility; warn the patient about this and make him/her avoid any twisting of that part in the hours of their vigils and sleep, and observe his/her revolts and agitations, and must oversee his/her activities, and must attend to all his/her movements with all your virtue; and wait for the position of the member to be one where the pain is alleviated, which is because when it is in a disposition causing pain or injury, you then change its position to one where it does not feel pain; and take care that the placement of it remains straight and even so that no deformity occurs in the member as it is restored.

For those that are thick like the skin or the leg, you should know that their wrapping should be loose and hard, as the tightness around each part connects the large member and strengthens it from all sides, so nothing gets in between.
